strategy: Apply polynomial feature expansion to the input variables (e.g., square, interaction terms between area and bedrooms) and train a Ridge regression model with L2 regularization to handle multicollinearity and prevent overfitting. This approach captures nonlinear relationships in the data while maintaining stability in predictions.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import Ridge
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numeric columns with median
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])
X_val[categorical_columns] = X_val[categorical_columns].fillna(X_val[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(X_test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# Create polynomial features
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures
poly = PolynomialFeatures(degree=2, include_bias=False, interaction_only=False)

# Fit polynomial features on training data
X_train_poly = poly.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_poly = poly.transform(X_val)
X_test_poly = poly.tran

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import Ridge
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numeric columns with median
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
mode_values = X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0]
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)
X_val[categorical_columns] = X_val[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)

# Encode categorical variables using one-hot encoding
encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore')
X_train_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_columns]).toarray()
X_val_encoded = encoder.transform(X_val[categorical_columns]).toarray()
X_test_encoded = encoder.transform(X_test[categorical_columns]).toarray()
